txt.en: 'I see now. A clever plan, indeed! This way, Grimbold frees me and gains the excuse he needs to deal with a likely traitor in their midst.\n\n'Well, as much as I would like to hear news from my kinsmen, I think I had best be going now.'
Caught in a Vice
You have the Strong Ale
The Eorl has spotted you!
Daervunn the Ranger is detained at the Ford of Isen.\n\nWhen the current guard leaves, put the ale someplace where Arbald is likely to stumble upon it.
Daervunn the Ranger is detained at the Ford of Isen.\n\nYou should wait until Arbald drinks himself into a stupour, then cut the imprisoned Ranger loose, but be careful not to let the guard spot you.
Wait until the Eorl takes the bait and intoxicates himself on duty, then cut the imprisoned Ranger loose!\n\nDon't let the guard spot you!
'O-ho! It seems that fate does indeed smile upon me today!'
'Not only do I have the pleasure of seeing this fool of a Ranger squirm...'
'... but it seems that my fellow guard has forgotten his ale on watch.'
'Bottom's up!'
'Ahhh. That is better...'
Place the ale in the guard's post when the shift changes
Release Daervunn when Arbald falls asleep. Be careful not to let him see you
Release the ranger when the Eorl falls asleep/nDon't let the Eorl see you
Don't let the Eorl see you
Don't let the Eorl see you
'What are you doing over there? Aren't you going to cut me loose?'
'Well whatever your plan is you'd better get out of sight, I see a guard coming up the hill.'
'Bah. You skulking woodsmen are no better than these Dunlending barbarians.'
'Where was I? Oh yes, the high and mighty Men of the Western Isle! Kings of Old!'

Grimbold has come up with a plan to deal with two problems at once: a treacherous warrior and an imprisoned Ranger. The man he believes to be a lackey of Isengard volunteered to guard the Ranger and might have his fondness for strong drink exploited.
'You don't look like much now, do you!?'
'Soon Saruman shall be lord of these lands, and my family will rule by his side from the seat of Edoras.'
'ZZZzzz....'
'No more begging for scraps from the table of Th√©oden.'
'Well, my mysterious friend, it seems the lazy high-born lout who is supposed to relieve me is late as always.'
A convenient spot
'I do not suppose you will be going anywhere for the minute or two that it will take to kick him out of his sack.'
'Get up fool, it is your shift.'
A flask of ale would be readily discovered lying here...
'So, you fools thought to smear the name of Saruman, eh?'
'Soon the alliance between my house and Isengard will ensure our fortune.'
'The fool is asleep! Quickly, untie me!'
'You, on the other hand, will be enjoying a cell in Edoras until such time as we decide your fate.'
'I've no doubt Grimbold will deal with the fine Eorl here - but you'd best not be seen with me.'
'Eh? What's this?'
'Eh? Who's there? [placeholder]? Be off with you! Your friend here is going to Edoras in the morning. Grimer will be most interested to speak with him.'
'Farewell [placeholder] - till we meet again!'
'You say that you need some ale for a friend of yours? Ha! But you did us a great favour, so I am more than happy to indulge you.\n\n'Here you go. You and your 'friend' can drink to your health.'
